executive summary.company synopsis: ATI Inc., formerly known as Allegheny Technologies Incorporated, is an American producer of specialty materials headquartered in Dallas, Texas. The company manufactures a range of high-performance materials, including titanium and titanium alloys, nickel-based alloys and superalloys, stainless and specialty steels, zirconium, hafnium, and niobium, as well as tungsten materials, forgings, and castings. ATI serves key markets such as aerospace and defense, oil and gas, chemical processing, electrical energy, and medical industries.

customer engagement suite.elevator pitch:

Your 8,100-person workforce spans 30+ global locations, yet 35% agent turnover in high-volume centers could disrupt critical customer relationships worth $4.4 billion annually.

detailed account intelligence.company description:
ATI Inc., formerly known as Allegheny Technologies Incorporated, is an American producer of specialty materials headquartered in Dallas, Texas. The company manufactures a range of high-performance materials, including titanium and titanium alloys, nickel-based alloys and superalloys, stainless and specialty steels, zirconium, hafnium, and niobium, as well as tungsten materials, forgings, and castings. ATI serves key markets such as aerospace and defense, oil and gas, chemical processing, electrical energy, and medical industries.

ATI Inc. specializes in the production of specialty materials and components, operating through two primary segments: High Performance Materials & Components (HPMC) and Advanced Alloys & Solutions (AA&S). The HPMC segment focuses on materials such as titanium and titanium-based alloys, nickel- and cobalt-based alloys and superalloys, and other specialty materials in various long product forms, including ingot, billet, bar, rod, wire, shapes, rectangles, and seamless tubes. This segment also produces precision forgings, components, and machined parts, primarily serving the aerospace and defense, medical, and energy markets. The AA&S segment produces zirconium and related alloys, including hafnium and niobium, nickel-based alloys, titanium and titanium-based alloys, and specialty alloys in forms such as plate, sheet, and precision rolled strip products. This segment caters to the energy, aerospace and defense, automotive, and electronics markets.

**Key Call Outs**

- ATI launched a new customer-focused enterprise website to enhance customer engagement and provide comprehensive information about their products and services.
detailed account intelligence.firmographics:
- Company name: Allegheny Technologies

- Country: United States of America

- Industry: Specialty Materials Manufacturing

- Employee range: 5,000-10,000

- Target Segment: B2B

business indicators.strategic partnerships and memberships:
- Became the 100th member of the University of Strathclyde's Advanced Forming Research Centre (AFRC), joining as one of only six Tier One Members alongside founding members like Rolls-Royce and Boeing 

- Committed to collaborative expertise sharing and innovation through the AFRC, with plans to participate in managing and technical boards 

- Recognized for ability to perform end-to-end across the entire jet engine supply chain, with plans to collaboratively share expertise and learn from industry partners
business indicators.operational expansion and capacity enhan:
- Announced $28 million expansion of Richland, WA plant located in the Horn Rapids Industrial Park 

- Restarted Albany, OR operations 

- Expanded titanium melt capacity by 80% over the past two years, taking advantage of customers diversifying away from Russian suppliers and preparing for commercial aerospace OEM re-ramp 

- Actively pursuing opportunities in the electric vehicle (EV) market by developing specialty alloys and components suitable for EV battery applications
business indicators.strategic positioning and market develop:
- Company officially renamed from Allegheny Technologies Incorporated to ATI, with domain change to ATImaterials.com 

- Reclassified to Global Industry Classification Standard (GICS) Aerospace and Defense code, recognizing company's transformation into a world-class A&D supplier 

- Strategic vision to be an aligned and integrated specialty materials and components company, solving the world's challenges through materials science, targeting products and global growth markets that require ATI's technical and manufacturing capabilities 

- Strategically evaluating potential acquisitions and partnerships to access new technologies and markets, contributing to revenue growth and market share expansion
business indicators.product innovation and development:
- Developing specialized alloy powder materials for additive manufacturing, combining materials science and forging expertise for aerospace, defense, and space markets 

- Continuing leadership in specialty materials and components for commercial and military jet engines, supporting initial build requirements and spare parts with a fully qualified asset base 

- Strategic focus on partnerships, including collaborating with suppliers to ensure raw material supply and partnering with R&D institutions to drive innovation in materials science
business indicators.market commitments and contract wins:
- Secured estimated $1.2 billion in aerospace and defense sales commitments, representing an average of $200 million per year between 2024 and 2029, with materials for commercial engine and airframe applications and ground-vehicle armor 

- Commitments will be served through announced capital and capacity expansions, supporting industry stabilization and providing a path for future growth through the decade 

- Secured a new six-year labor agreement with the United Steelworkers (USW), extending through February 28, 2031, providing stability and competitive wages to nearly 1,000 employees

technology initiatives.digital infrastructure and cloud service:
- Deployed Microsoft Azure Cloud Services for Application Hosting and Computing Services, supporting the company's digital transformation efforts across multiple business operations 

- Implemented New Relic APM for Application Performance Management to monitor and optimize application performance across the organization 

- Exploring investment in emerging technologies including AI, Machine Learning, IoT, and cloud-based enterprise applications as part of strategic technology roadmap
technology initiatives.research and development technology part:
- Became the 100th member of the University of Strathclyde's Advanced Forming Research Centre (AFRC), joining as one of only six Tier One Members to collaborate on innovative manufacturing technologies and accelerate industry innovation 

- Joined alongside founding members like Rolls-Royce and Boeing to advance research in advanced forming and manufacturing technologies 

- Continuing significant investment in research and development to stay at the forefront of technological advancements in specialty materials and components
technology initiatives.manufacturing technology expansion:
- Announced $28 million expansion of Richland WA plant in the Horn Rapids Industrial Park, enhancing advanced metal processing capabilities 

- Restarted Albany OR operations to increase production capacity and technological capabilities 

- Enhanced Richland plant with electron beam furnace for metal liquefaction, defect removal, and vacuum arc remelting process, capable of producing billets up to 44,000 pounds
technology initiatives.patent and innovation development:
- Filed patents for specialty metals including titanium and titanium alloys, nickel-based alloys, superalloys, stainless and specialty steels, zirconium, hafnium, and niobium materials 

- Expanded patent portfolio for advanced metal processing technologies, including electron beam melting and vacuum arc remelting processes 

- Developed patents for engineered forgings and castings, grain-oriented electrical steel, and specialty alloy technologies focused on aerospace, defense, and energy applications
technology initiatives.sustainable technology integration:
- Partnered with We Energies to use solar power for sustainable energy generation, reducing environmental impact of manufacturing operations 

- Developing lightweight materials for aerospace applications to improve fuel efficiency and reduce emissions, leveraging expertise in advanced alloys and composites 

- Providing materials and solutions for renewable energy sector, including applications in turbines and power generation systems
technology initiatives.strategic technology investments:
- Expanding product portfolio with investments in electric vehicle market, developing specialty alloys for EV battery applications and components 

- Strategically evaluating potential acquisitions and partnerships to access new technologies and expand market share in emerging technology sectors 

- Undertook strategic capital projects to enhance and upgrade facilities, including expansions of titanium and premium-melt nickel-based alloy, superalloy, and specialty alloy production capabilities

financial overview.revenue:
- Full year 2024 sales of $4.4 billion, representing the company's highest total since 2012 and up 5% over full year 2023 

- Q4 2024 revenues of $1.17 billion, surpassing the Zacks Consensus Estimate by 8.23%, compared to year-ago revenues of $1.06 billion 

- Q3 2024 revenues of $1.05 billion, compared to year-ago revenues of $1.03 billion 

- Q1 2024 earnings of $0.48 per share, beating the Zacks Consensus Estimate, with revenues of $1.04 billion, matching the previous year's revenues
financial overview.net income:
- Full year 2024 net income attributable to ATI of $368 million, or $2.55 per share 

- Q4 2024 net income attributable to ATI of $137.1 million, or $0.94 per share
financial overview.market performance:
- The company's stock has added about 39% since the beginning of the year, outperforming the S&P 500's gain of 22.1%

- Currently holds a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold), with shares expected to perform in line with the market in the near future
financial overview.sales composition: - Aerospace and defense represented 65% of Q4 2024 sales, up from 62% of Q3 2024 sales and 63% of Q4 2023 sales

competitors.haynes international:
A leading developer, manufacturer, and distributor of high-performance alloys for high-temperature and corrosion applications, primarily serving Aerospace, Chemical Processing, and Industrial Gas Turbine industries.

**Key Points of Differentiation:**

- Innovation through developing new alloys, with a unique business model utilizing both mill and company-owned service centers, providing exceptional customer service with short lead times and value-added cutting operations

- Continuous alloy development, with nine new proprietary alloys developed since 2000, five of which are currently commercially available
competitors.nucor corporation:
A leading steel producer in the United States manufacturing carbon and alloy steel that directly competes with ATI's offerings.

**Key Points of Differentiation:**

- Strong leadership, with employees rating their CEO Roger Newport 90 out of 100

- Focus on steel production across various industrial sectors
competitors.precision castparts corp:
An American industrial goods and metal fabrication company that manufactures investment castings, forged components, and airfoil castings for aerospace, industrial gas turbine, and defense industries.

**Key Points of Differentiation:**

- Market leader in manufacturing large, complex structural investment castings, airfoil castings, forged components, and highly engineered critical fasteners for aerospace applications

- Expertise in extending aerospace airfoil technology to industrial gas turbine industry, growing from zero to over 50% market share by 2001 by helping customers burn turbines hotter and more efficiently
competitors.carpenter technology:
A specialty metals company that produces and distributes high-performance alloys, stainless steels, and titanium products.

**Key Points of Differentiation:**

- Noted for leadership, with employees rating their CEO Tony Thene

- Specialization in advanced metal production across various industrial applications

industry trends.advanced aerospace materials: Metals remain critical in aerospace, with a shift towards advanced titanium and nickel-based superalloys. These materials provide high-temperature, superior strength, and corrosion resistance, making them essential for jet engines and structural components.
industry trends.additive manufacturing (3d printing): 3D printing produces lightweight and strong components with intricate designs that would be expensive and time-consuming to create traditionally. Metal powder-bed fusion and advanced composites are key technologies for producing optimized parts, particularly titanium components. The technology improves aircraft design by allowing more aerodynamically-efficient components that reduce fuel consumption and enables on-demand manufacturing to reduce inventory costs and lead times.
industry trends.sustainable materials innovation: The aerospace industry is prioritizing sustainability by adopting bio-based composites, recyclable thermoplastics, and low-emission alloys. This includes exploring biodegradable composite materials for non-structural aircraft components, using recycled carbon fiber, and researching hydrogen-resistant alloys to support alternative fuel transitions.
industry trends.ai-driven materials development: Artificial intelligence and quantum computing are accelerating the discovery of next-generation aerospace materials. These technologies identify new alloys and composites with unprecedented strength, durability, and heat resistance by analyzing vast datasets and simulating atomic interactions.

customer engagement suite.detailed reasoning: ATI operates in specialty materials manufacturing with $4-5B revenue and 5,000-10,000 employees, falling below CES's ideal ≥100 agents threshold. Their tech stack shows AWS/Azure cloud adoption and CX solutions including Zendesk, suggesting some customer service infrastructure. However, as a B2B specialty metals manufacturer serving aerospace/defense markets, their customer interactions likely involve technical consultations rather than high-volume support requiring advanced conversational AI. The manufacturing industry focus on operational efficiency aligns with AI automation interests, but their customer engagement model differs significantly from CES's typical high-interaction volume ICP.
customer engagement suite.factors increasing the score:
- Revenue of $4-5B meets CES's ≥$500M threshold requirement

- Employee count of 5,000-10,000 indicates enterprise scale operations

- Existing CX technology stack including Zendesk shows customer service infrastructure investment

- Cloud adoption with AWS and Azure demonstrates technology modernization willingness

- Aerospace/defense focus suggests compliance-heavy environment where CES security features (CMEK, VPC-SC) provide value
customer engagement suite.factors decreasing the score:
- B2B specialty manufacturing model unlikely to generate ≥2M annual customer interactions

- Manufacturing industry typically has lower customer service agent requirements than CES ICP

- Technical consultation-heavy customer interactions may not benefit from standard conversational AI flows

- Current CX stack appears adequate for their business model without indicating expansion needs

- No clear indicators of customer service pain points like high wait times or containment issues
customer engagement suite.potential next steps:
- Qualify actual customer interaction volumes and agent count to confirm ICP fit

- Explore potential compliance automation use cases given aerospace/defense regulatory requirements

- Assess interest in AI-powered technical support for complex materials specifications and engineering consultations

it decision maker.talking points:
- Given ATI's complex specialty materials business and high customer service demands across aerospace and defense sectors, a Dialogflow CX virtual agent could handle routine technical inquiries and material specifications 24/7, potentially deflecting 50% of basic calls like Marks & Spencer achieved in 60 days.

- With ATI's global operations spanning 30+ US locations and international facilities, Agent Assist's real-time transcription and Gemini summaries could reduce your technical support team's call wrap-up time by up to 90 seconds per interaction, similar to Best Buy's results.

- Since ATI serves critical aerospace and defense customers requiring precise quality standards, Quality AI could automatically score compliance adherence and technical accuracy across customer interactions, eliminating manual QA processes while tightening audit trails for your regulated industry requirements.

- Given your recent $28 million Richland plant expansion and operational scaling initiatives, Conversational Insights could cluster contact trends around new product launches or capacity changes, helping your CX and operations teams respond to customer concerns the same day.

- With ATI's current Zendesk deployment and customer service technology stack, Google CES offers one-click native integration, allowing you to enhance existing workflows without disrupting your established support processes.

- As ATI transitions leadership and focuses on aerospace market expansion, real-time sentiment analysis could flag spikes in customer concerns about delivery timelines or material quality, enabling your team to proactively address issues before they impact key defense contractor relationships.

- During peak demand periods driven by your aerospace customers' production cycles, CES's elastic pay-per-use model automatically scales support capacity without fixed infrastructure costs, aligning perfectly with the cyclical nature of your specialty materials business.
it decision maker.probing questions:
- Given ATI's global manufacturing operations across 30+ locations and your recent aerospace & defense focus representing 62% of sales, how are you currently managing customer support across different time zones and technical complexity levels - and what challenges do you face in maintaining consistent service quality?

- With your $4.4 billion revenue scale and diverse product portfolio spanning titanium alloys to specialty materials, what does your current customer experience technology landscape look like, and how well does it integrate with your existing Microsoft, Oracle, and SAP systems?

- As you've secured $1.2 billion in aerospace and defense commitments through 2029, how are you preparing your customer support operations to scale with this growth while managing the technical complexity of serving customers like Boeing and Rolls-Royce?

- Considering your global workforce of 8,100 employees and operations spanning North America, Europe, and Asia, what are your biggest priorities for improving customer service efficiency and reducing operational costs over the next 18 months?

- Are you currently using any form of AI-powered virtual agents or chatbots to handle routine customer inquiries across your specialty materials business?

- On a scale of 1-5, how would you rate your current ability to automatically monitor and score customer service quality across all your global locations and customer touchpoints?

- Given your use of Microsoft 365 and various CRM systems, would having a customer experience platform that seamlessly integrates with your existing tech stack through one-click connectors be valuable for your operations?

customer engagement suite.the google advantage:
- While many platforms require months of complex setup and rigid intent mapping, Google CES delivers Agent Assist in just 10 days and full virtual agents in under 90 days through hybrid deterministic-LLM architecture that maintains guardrails while handling free-form queries naturally.

- Unlike typical contact-center stacks that charge per channel or language, Google CES provides 100+ languages across voice, chat, SMS, WhatsApp, and email in a single design with pay-per-use pricing that auto-scales, enabling companies like Bell Canada to expand to 10,000 agents while saving $20M quarterly.

- Traditional CX-AI solutions often struggle with enterprise security and integration complexity, whereas Google CES includes Customer-Managed Encryption Keys, VPC Service Controls, and one-click connectors for Salesforce, Zendesk, and ServiceNow, delivering proven outcomes like Marks & Spencer's 50% call deflection in just 60 days.
